reviewText: This has aerobic parts from all the 6 original Firm workouts.The first time I did this tape I was going to beg for mercy.After a couple time I have grown to love it.It has all the original insructers featured on it.Susan Harris,Janet Gretzky,Sandahl Bergman, and all the others are featured on it.You will need  dumbells about 3-8 pounds,an aerobic step 6-to 10 inches tall.It also has a lot of floor aerobic on it with a lot of jumping jacks,runnin in place,and some fancy dance moves.I do not reccomend this tape for beginners.Intermediate to advanced is the level of this tape.It takes some getting used to.I love it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love the old school Firm Tapes, but you may want to watch out with this one. The majority of the workout is running in place and half jacks. They do get the heart rate up but they are hard on your knees or have alot of weight to lose.I did like the segments that use the weights and the short box, and before the ending stertch there's a nice section that works the glutes.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A compilation of exercise segments from 6 Firm volumes, Tough Aerobic Mix will definitely give you a strong workout. I love it ! The instructors are no-nonsense ladies who barely break a smile and who move you from upper body toning and low-impact aerobics to hi-impact aerobics and lower body strengthening. I have no problem with "dated" 80's aerobics. Exercise is exercise, and I like to feel my heart race. Also, this video includes alot of the upper body toning that I never do enough of.  This is my only FIRM video, but if I get another I'll try to find a compilation again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: YES its from the 80's  YES some of the people wear leg warmers  SO WHAT?  I own many types of exercise tapes and the FIRM are by far the toughest to do (cathe friedrich is the exception).  I like the TAM because it swiches insructors, it really gets the heart rate up, and it gives u short breaks just when your about ready to sit back and give up. Ive been doing firm tapes for over a year now, i went from 140 and little muscle tone to 133, nice muscle tone.  I still eat a healthy 1400 cals a day(and i cheat too soemtiems ;)  These workouts are by far the best
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this video because I realized that the majority of my Firm videos were what they refer to as "Tortoise" which means a lot of weight work and little cardio work.  This video is entirely cardio work, about  30-40 min of it, plus short warmup and cooldown sections.  I would say that  this is good for those like me who aren't great at doing complicated  footwork, but want to get aerobic effects.  You will need a short aerobic  step for some of the workouts on this tape.  This tape was compiled from  original Firm videos and each segments is introduced by "your personal  fitness trainer."  This is a great video for cardio fitness.  I would  say some of the workouts were higher impact than others, so beware if you  are bothered by jumps.
summary: A great addition to your Firm collection
Title: N/A

reviewText: "The Firm Parts: Not-So Tough Aerobics" is a combination of step aeorbics and standing floor moves, some with weights and some without. This tape was edited from about half a dozen earlier "The Firm" workout tapes -- 7 minutes here, 3 minutes there -- like one of those serial TV shows that shows bits & pieces from previous shows. The lady pictured on the cover fills in transitions between segments, telling you what equipment to get and how to stand to get ready for the next segment.Tough Aerobics Mix" is an extremely challenging aerobic workout. Unlike most Firm workout tapes, this exercise session only uses light weights (3 to 5 lbs) and a low step (3" to 7"). So it is suitable for days between weightlifting sessions. Some of the exercises are low impact, and some segments are bouncy/high impact.One problem with this workout tape is that the edits are disruptive. The visual transitions from set to set give the exercise session a "cheap" feel. Still, the overall workout is worthwhile.I exercize regularly, but I just cannot keep up with the pace of this tape. I would recommend this tape only to people who are in excellent physical condition -- if you do 5+ hours of aerobics each week and 3+ hours of weightlifting, you'll greatly enjoy this tape.This workout has background music that is enjoyable and varied.  Visually, the workout quite entertaining:  colorful backdrop, statues, murrals on the wall, and a variety of people exercising in different clothing.  It looks like you are in a class with many other people.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this VHS tape when it was first released in 1993. It really killed me and gave me a great aerobic workout. I wonder for the people who claim it's too easy if they were using a ten inch step or using the shorter ones. I purchased the original ten inch and 14 inch wood steps from The Firm when the late Anna Benson was still the original owner. The 10 inch short aerobic step will spike up your heart rate like crazy, plus if you have trouble toning the front of your legs (quads), the ten inch step will hit these muscles until they are fried. I still use my steps after twenty years of use. They were made with excellent quality. I had to reorder this tape and regret throwing my original one out due to a move.This a great aerobic workout with some strength training. A true keeper.
